title: Very Dissapointed
body:
I am INCREDIBLY disappointed that in the new urgot rework there is no voice line to sion's "sorry urgot we can't hang anymore, i'm cool now"

Riot, we expected more from you

replies.body: Hey imbrus, sorry we couldn't make it work, there were technical limitations. {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}} I wrote a more detailed response [here](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/4WF61pEa-no-urgot-response-to-sions-taunt-about-being-too-cool-for-him-to-hang-out-with?comment=0003).
So Urgot can still give a response to Sion (through Ulti) but PF Cait still doesn't have a response line to Vi? Is it for the same reason as Urgot's to Sion?

Vi does have two taunts to Cait, so it would be impossible to respond to either directly with the current tech. I'll mention all the frustration to our engineers. We get new features all the time, maybe this is something we could do in the future.

Hopefully, but I still don't understand one thing. Minus the response taunts, why wasn't there any taunts towards Vi? Not even when attacking her, same team as her, or even Ulti her? I thought PF Cait would have at least one of these things to say for Vi but yet there was none.

> [{quoted}](name=Interlocutioner,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=johdG1Lj,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-07-12T16:44:03.551+0000)
>
> Hey imbrus, sorry we couldn't make it work, there were technical limitations. 

Riot spent millions of dollars, thousands of man hours and sacrificed a lot of features (including Dominion) to get a new client up and running... and "technical limitations" STILL EXIST?

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}
New Client limitations are different from In Game limitations. By the sounds of it, this is an In Game limitation
That was my response too, lol.
Sounds like the game just has to be put into a new engine altogether. Heroes of the Storm never has this kind of problem.
Wouldn't that mean a major systems requirement change? A lot of players have old computers.
IMO, players who are using a TI-83 don't deserve to play MOBAs.
They're one of the least graphically intensive games.

Not necessarily. Just like you don't need an entirely new computer to run the Unreal Engine vs Unity Engine for games, the new engine could work within the existing minimum requirements.

The biggest thing to consider is that we're asking for things that weren't even a consideration when League's engine was first built. They had *maybe* 20 voice lines for Champions, they weren't concerned with making a system that could handle hundreds of lines and keep track of who said what. 

Blizzard likely looked at League and DotA's shortcomings and designed their engine to do things the others couldn't. 5 years from now they may run into other issues with HotS that Riot can avoid with a new engine they build, etc.

That's a shame

oh well, keep up the good work
There is, you get it when Urgot kills Sion with his ult.
